description: This course aims to help students become intelligent observers of politics as practiced in Philadelphia. It also intends to relate Philadelphia politics to broader theories about the political process in cities and in America as a whole. The course will examine broad issues of political values in Philadelphia, the state of the party system in Philadelphia, elections, and the decision-making process. The course will include both analysis of the political system as a whole as well as specific issues around which politics in Philadelphia have revolved in recent years. Issues include the politics of economic development, neighborhood politics in Philadelphia, and the politics of the city budget.
name: PHILA POLITICS
